Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: BuckAngel
Reviews.Content: This place saved me from the scary Andrew Jackson hotel that is next door. I booked a room at the AJ and when I checked in I freaked out- It was a crack den for sure! So I asked if they could move me..and really to make a very long story short I just went outside to the Nine-O-Five and the owner was so sweet she had a room available and let me check in right then. It is so "New Orleans" really charming and feels like you are staying in your aunts house:) I have since returned there and had just as great of a stay as the first time. Actually this review is a long time coming because I just started reviewing but I promised I would do this because the owners are so lovely! Trust me you will not be disappointed. It's not the Ritz so do not expect that. It is old but it is very New Orleans if that is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “If you want the French Quarter, it don't get better than the 905 Royal hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Joseph K
Reviews.Content: After reading some bad reviews of this place I said "what the hell I will try it anyway." My wife and I were so glad we did! If you want the French quarter this is the place. If you want the Hilton then its not. First of all its more like a bed and breakfest than a hotel, second the people there were great!! Larry was such a help!!! The place was clean, and in the best location right in the middle of things. I cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for my activities”
Reviews.Author: jrcline
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed here and I really like antique decor, balcony, and porch. The relaxed friendly atmosphere gives me a homey feeling. I find the historical nature of the hotel inspiring for my photography activities in the French Quarter and surrounding areas. It has always been clean and well neat.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, rude staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: BellaChristinaMarie
Reviews.Content: Â Avoid: disgusting, awkward and insane! IÂ arrived at Nine O Five Royal hotel to be greeted by painters and waited a bit till Joyce came out to greet me. It was a little awkward and not the warm southern hospitality I was expecting but she was still pleasant. I read some horrible reviews about this place but decided to give it a go. When I was shown my room it seemed kind of run down and dirty but still charming in a rustic way. I pulled back the sheets and literally found at least 8 hairs. I was going to let it go but at the bottom of the sheets was a clump of eyelashes- disgusting! I went to the office and pretty much had the door slammed in my face by a blonde woman with bad teeth. I kindly asked her to assist and I have never been so shocked by the response. If she hadn't said she worked at the hotel I would have thought I had stumbled into a mental asylum. She first went into crazy denial and called me a fool, I stayed polite and said it sometimes happens in very good hotels and all I wanted was the sheets changed. I even showed her the clump of eyelashes and she said she couldn't see anything and where was my magnifying glass. Well maybe she has some eye problems but take a look at my photos and judge for yourself. The woman stormed off uttering rude comments and slammed the gate and the office door- I was shocked! Then I ran into Joyce and tried to explain and she cut me off without so much as an apology and said the maid would come. I again offered to show her the sheets and she went into this rant about how she had never had this kind of complaint before like I was making it up, I then mentioned all the disgusting comments about the hotel on Trip Advisor and she said she never heard of it. Super awkward and leaves a very bad impression. All they had to do was apologize, say it never happens and how wonderful they are and change the sheets immediately and everyone moves on instead of alienate, deny and lie. The other bad thing was that they go against the norm and you cannot cancel and they immediately charge your credit card. By the way they did change the sheets and this time there were only 3 hairs in my bed! Avoid this hotel at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Do It!!”
Reviews.Author: cate1yellow
Reviews.Content: The location was great. It was so great that I would stay across the street next time I visit NOLA. We had 9 people in our group so we had all but one of the rooms. The wall paper was literaly peeling off the walls. The paint was peeling off the front of the building. It was hell trying to get an extra towel. The bathroom had hair on the floor and was not clean when we arrived. Each day that our room was serviced all of our things were moved around by the maid. The room was small and that is okay so we used the kitchen to store our luggage. It was all taken out of the kitchen and left in the middle of our room so we had to straighten after the maid left. The room was set up for four people to sleep but there was not enough light in the dreary room to be able to get ready. There was not a dresser in our room. There wasn't a place to hang towels and it was a chore to try and get one extra towel. The owner was snippy and unhelpful from the first phone call until we checked out. Another of the rooms had a shower that would not drain. It was never fixed. I was so disappointed in this lodging. I have stayed in other old and renovated places in NOLA and they were tiny but wonderful. This was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Awful....DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Sublime35
Reviews.Content: Just to much to put into words..... All the bad reviews about the condition of the 2 bedroom suite were spot on. Upon arriving the WiFi was not working.......was told it was my problem since the person I was speaking to didn't now how to fix it. Refused to refund my money so I could stay in a place that had working WiFi ( I need it for work).....was told feel free to go somewhere else but we are not going to give you a refund for your prepaid 4 nights.........was hung up on and then stopped answering my calls....rude rude and ignorant to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Could be a lot better w/ a little attention”
Reviews.Author: wimberleydlc
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a two bedrm/one bath unit @905 Royal in February 2012 (upper level/unit on right if facing it from the street). Stayed w/ my husband and a friend. We have stayed there one other time in Nov. 2010 (unit on upper left). During the previous trip we really enjoyed the balcony, which is the main reason we returned, but weather was too cold for the balcony this time. This unit seemed fairly clean w/ the exception of the stained antique chairs and sofa. If I were the owner, I would be embarrassed by this. I didn't even want to sit on them! The unit has a small kitchen w/ frig. and sink, stove top and coffeemaker. We would have appreciated a microwave and some paper towels. The real problem is the bathroom. The shower drains very slowly and the water backs up as you are showering. I do think that the shower in this unit is larger than what I remember in the opposite unit. Okay, now for the issue w/ the sink area of the bathroom. If you a female that needs to do hair and makeup you are not going to like this! Even the two males staying w/ me complained about it! The sink is in a little cutout area, just large enough to house the sink itself. This is hard to explain...should have taken a photo. The mirror is hung on the wall on the left of the sink, but because of the size of the cutout, you can't stand across from the mirror to see into it. There is a plug by the sink but it seems unsafe because the cord from my blow dryer kept falling into the sink and of course you can't see into the mirror while blow drying your hair. How about a mirror on the wall across from you when your facing the sink? The bathroom desperately needs a shelf, there is absolutely nowhere to put any of your toiletries, etc. (this was also a problem in the opposite unit). Possibly make a vanity area elsewhere w/ a good mirror and an outlet close enough so you can at least blow dry your hair. The beds were fairly comfortable although a little firm. Plenty of pillows. Large closet in each bedroom. Although I thought the maid was doing a good job cleaning, we a little issue w/ her. We asked her for towels one day and told her we didn't really need service. She insisted on coming in and at least making the beds, which we agreed to and then went to lunch. We came back about an hour and a half later and were surprised that she was still in there. When she left we realized she had put our razor, shaving cream, toothbrushes, toothpaste, etc back in our suitcase. Some of our friends stuff was in our suitcase and our in his. Our large suitcase was open on a coffee table when we left, but when we returned, she had put "stuff" in it, zipped it and stood it up by the closet. This was very strange. We felt a bit violated. We reported this to the owner before we left. I don't think the maid meant any harm, but maybe hadn't been properly trained. One more thing that really bothered my husband...because it was too cold to spend time on balcony, we at least wanted to look out and every time we tried to pull up the mini blinds we had problems! Blinds are cheap, how about updating them. I feel if the owner would spend a night in each of her units (and shower and do her hair and makeup). The changes that need to be made would be very obvious.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Chimama1
Reviews.Content: Please don't waste your money here. For a minimal effort,we would have felt so much more welcome,and that effort certainly wasn't made. For a $1000 w/e we had a new box of kleenex. One of the beds didn't even look clean.It cost $120 to park for the w/e.There are many many more hotels with the same great location that are not a shabby dump.The wallpaper is puckered and peeling.It is so obvious that the owners either don't care or are too lazy to take any pride in their establishment! I had brought 2 friends...had stayed there in the 1980's, and kept apologizing all w/e.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, affordable”
Reviews.Author: D2theWest
Reviews.Content: What a hidden little treasure. Great location too, very close to Bourbon Street. I stayed in their very smallest room, and as I was warned on the phone, it is quite small. But it was exactly what I wanted: an affordable room close to Bourbon Street. I was there for the street activities, not the hotel! The room was clean and the staff was very polite. I would describe it as a renovated house more than a hotel. But don't let this steer you away.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: lawprof3
Reviews.Content: As the title implies, if you want to stay near the action in the French Quarter, on Royal Street, and you don't mind a little inconvenience, then this hotel is for you. The owners are very friendly, but the accommodations are a little weird. I mean, my in-laws had to go through my room to reach the bathroom. In the bathroom you couldn't look at the mirror above the sink when you shaved because the bathroom was so small. The place was clean, but pricy. I wouldn't stay there again, but it was interesting for one time. The parking was about six blocks away and was about $25 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: KentCampbell
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for the New Orleans experience. Yes (as other reviews have stated) - it's "old" - it's supposed to be. We had a street level suite with original pocket doors to close off the bedroom. Little kitchen and bathroom built into the back - but perfectly fine for our needs. The bedroom and living room were beautiful. Staff was great and unobtrusive. Leo was very helpful and usually nearby if we needed advice on anything. Great location - close enough to be near the action but just enough outside to be quiet. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip. Probably same room if we can get it. Loved sitting on the porch drinking coffee or champagne and watching all the people go by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice not great”
Reviews.Author: Sasafrass7711
Reviews.Content: The location was nice, interesting to be in the french quarter and was pretty calm for it's location. The price feels too high for what you actually get. The room had beautiful furniture but the bathroom was tiny and felt old and the bed wasn't very comfortable. The porch was nice to sit out on at night.

Reviews.Title: “Classic New Orleans Charm”
Reviews.Author: nlmnyc
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here the week after Mardi Gras.... We were greeted at the gate by the friendly watchman/doorman, Mac. What a guy! He helped us in with our suitcases and was so friendly. I lived in a Queen Anne Victorian in college and this place completely reminded me of it. Huge ceilings with an antique chandelier hanging over the very king-size bed. The room was decorated nicely with antique furniture and included a spacious kitchenette with fridge, oven and coffeemaker. The best part had to be the big front porch where you can sit and watch the revelers and tourists go by. You're a block away from Bourbon St and the noise. At night, you feel like you might just live there as Royal gets quiet and you can hear crickets chirping... Fell in love with this place and it's now my go-to place to stay when I go to New Orleans.... Just great!

Reviews.Title: “1890's style and character, no cookie cutter hotel, the 905 Royal has authentic French Quarter flavor.”
Reviews.Author: HDSledgeLongBeach
Reviews.Content: Jane and Joyce make every effort to see to your personal needs and comfort. The rooms take one back in time to the original styles and designs of the 1800's. A real connection to local residents, the 905 is a regular tour stop and the oldest hotel in the French Quarter. My wife and I prefer to stay in the first floor rooms where there is a sitting room with TV, bedroom, bath and kitchen. The kitchen has a stove and refrigerator, sink, coffeemaker, etc. Plus there is a streetside private entrance (very good security system) and a covered balcony area with seating so you can watch passersby. Quaint, cozy, and most of all: ORIGINAL. No plastic remods. Feels like my great Grandmother's place. While there are more luxurious places to stay, if you want the real flavor and eclectic style of N.O. you have to stay here. It just FEELS like New Orleans. The location is one block towards the river from Bourbon Street and smack dab in the middle of everything. Royal street is one of the nicest residential streets in the Quarter and you can walk back to your room and get some peace and quiet whenever you like. The French Quarter is always busy so we bring a small fan to turn on to make some white noise so we can sleep more soundly. Works great. You might not need it at the 905 but it's a necessity it if you stay on or near Bourbon Street, which is very loud all the time. Parking tips: You can park right in front to unload and it's only a couple blocks to the secure riverfront parking area. Plus there are several public parking lots nearby. My strategy is to get there early, unload, and drive around for a while near the hotel. It's not too hard to find a parking place but be careful about where it is. Stay away from corner spots since streets are narrow and delivery trucks don't have the room to turn and they will hit your car. Take note of the signs. Tuesday and Thursday they clean the streets and you can't park in many areas when they do or they will tow your car. Once you find a spot don't move it since everything is walking distance. If you find a good spot and get a ticket it will cost $20, which is cheaper than the daily rate at most parking garages. Even if you don't get a ticket make sure to go online to N.O. traffic ticket site to check your license number for violations. Some local kids think it's funny to take your ticket and throw it away since the fine doubles every month it's not paid. You don't know you got a ticket but your fine is getting bigger. We've been coming to the French Quarter for years and have stayed at many of the local hotels. The 905 Royal is our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “This place has charachter!”
Reviews.Author: csatlanta1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the incredible location in the French Quarter and because the rest of the city was sold out. At the time of my booking this hotel was #143 out of 151 hotels in New Orleans, so I was expecting a complete dive. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. We arrived in the evening and a gentleman met us as we got out of the taxi with our keys. The room we were in had a door facing Royal street on the 1st floor. Yes, the furniture was old. Yes, the decorations were old. Yes, it smelled a little musty. But it was a great experience. There aren't big frills like Room Service and Mini Bars, but there is a kitchen with a full size refrigerator, coffee maker, adequate shower and bathroom facility, beautiful antique decorations, and most of all a true New Orleans experience. The one staff member that met us was available when we needed him for an iron, directions, and general friendly conversation. I agree that if you're looking for somewhere fancy look elsewhere, but if you're interested in a room with charachter that is literally one block from Bourbon street and walking distance of everything you need, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Real New Orleans experience”
Reviews.Author: island22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nine O Five Royal in October 2010 in a 2 bedroom unit that had a balcony that looked out on Royal Street. It is in a great location, easy walking distance to everything. Having a balcony to sit on for morning coffee or evening cocktails, it was a great way to view life in the quarter. Fun also to watch all the carriage drivers go by and spin their tales of the quarter, was great listening to the different stories they told of days gone by. The unit had 2 bedrooms, the front bedroom had a king bed and a small tv, the other bedroom had a queen bed, there was one bathroom off the second bedroom, small shower, but clean and serviceable, then a small kitchen with sink, fridge and microwave. It was not posh by any means, but clean and the maid service daily was prompt and accomodating and if you like old homes and the quirky features have, then this is the place for you. Great value for the accomodations and the location cannot be beat. There is a wonderful restaurant across the street from the hotel called Cafe Amelie, with one of the most beautiful courtyards in the quarter, and wonderful food as well. Definitely worth checking out. To sum it up, we enjoyed our stay at the Nine O Five and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own toilet plunger”
Reviews.Author: strangern
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the "nicer" 2 bedroom upstairs with the balcony views....The toilet stayed backed up, the balcony is shared/partitioned with noisey neighbors, the price is was over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: MissFlowers
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed here last July for my Birthday; it is our 4th time to stay at the 905 (one of which was our honeymoon...) We always reserve room number one, as we love to sit and read on "our" front porch. Room number one has 14 foot ceilings, an enormous, comfortable bed, a sizable closet, a kitchenette, and a small bathroom with a shower (no tub.) It is large enough to deal with the numerous hatboxes that seem to get involved in our trips to NOLA, plus the anteroom, plus our front porch. The security is fabulous (as is the location - quiet, but central to everything in the quarter) but what sets the 905 apart are the owners, Miss Jane and Miss Joyce. The property has been functioning as a family hotel for 3 generations; they are professional innkeepers with hearts of gold. There is no parking, but when we arrived late Friday afternoon, they had "scoped out" a spot around the corner where we could park for free for the weekend, and keep an eye on our car - their food recommendations are always spot on, the rooms are SPOTLESS, and we love it. My best friend recommended it to me - we are both love fancy schmancy hotels, (which the 905 isn't!) but who needs a fancy hotel when you can have an authentic room in an authentic hotel in an authentically lovely city?

Reviews.Title: “Botched reservation”
Reviews.Author: rhodetravler
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience. I called the hotel to make the reservation. Since they couldn't do it by phone, I made it on the internet using my credit card. They called the next day to say they didn't accept credit cards and would need a check. After I sent a check, they informed me my reservation could no longer be honored. Take my advise and stay at a real hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: prettylady82
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 905 two times and stayed in two different room classes. We stayed in a two bedroom balcony suite during the first visit, which I highly recommend. The view is wonderful with the Cornstalk Hotel next door and beautiful architecture across the way. The location is fantastic - extremely close to Bourbon Street and a short walk to Cafe du Monde and Jackson Square. The staff allowed us to keep our luggage at the hotel before checking in and after check out time, as well. It is gated, and I always felt safe. The double room is a bit small, but I had no complaints. Unlike reviews I've read of other hotels in the French Quarter, we never saw any roaches or rodents, nor did we smell any odors. The beds were comfortable, but it is not a luxury hotel. I recommend this charming hotel if you really want to experience NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Royal Street”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Nine-O-Five Royal is centrally located in the French Quarter with access to great restaurants, wonderful music and many attractions. The hotel is small, with charm, but without much fuss or complexity. The hotel is not high-tech, upscale or filled with amenities. It is just very pleasurable accommodations at a good rate. The hotel staff is friendly, helpful and low key. You enjoy privacy and quiet here. There is a small kitchen for those who might like a meal at home. The one drawback is a very small bathroom, without much space for cosmetics or other items. On the whole, this is a very nice place to stay in a lovely environment.

HotelInfo.Name: Nine-O-Five Royal Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 905 Royal St, New Orleans, LA 70116
